title: Gobal economic interactions, c. 1750 to c. 2000

content.description:
Directions: 

Write your responses. Each response is expected to fit within the space provided.

In your responses, be sure to address all parts of the questions you answer. Use complete sentences; an outline or bulleted list alone is not acceptable.
content.question:
Map 1: BRITISH, SPANISH, AND DUTCH TRADE ROUTES AS SHOWN BY SHIP LOGS, 1750 to 1800.

Heavier shading indicates more frequently used routes.

James Cheshire 2012. Data provided by CLIWOC

Map 2: COMMERCIAL SHIPPING LANES, 2010. Heavier shading indicates more frequently used routes.

Source: http://www.nceas.ucsb.edu/globalmarine/impacts

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
